commit_message:
Ensure <service>_restart_bundle do not run concurrently

Now that paunch containers are run asynchronously, some
containers used for HA orchestration can run concurrently,
which triggers a deadlock and cause them to time out and
exit in error.
To overcome this concurrency deadlock, tweak the start_order
configuration of each HA service to make sure that no
<service>_restart_bundle container can be started at the same
time during a given step.

Change-Id: I9ae55101945978ea6c65d37eaa8221ed3d96a7f5
Closes-Bug: #1873893
(cherry picked from commit 690124682728f56d36701e852a899aaf8ee91940)

buildah: allow to exclude images from build

It can be useful when we want to skip some images, now we can with the
excludes argument (default empty list).

commit_message:
[k8s] Upgrade k8s dashboard version to v2.0.0

Heapster has been deprecated for a while and the new k8s dashboard
2.0.0 version supports metrics-server now. So it's time to upgrade
the default k8s dashboard to v2.0.0.

Task: 39101
Story: 2007256

Change-Id: I02f8cb77b472142f42ecc59a339555e60f5f38d0

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-05-23 05:29:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/4e29c3a82512be04c88f1503f79e805ddfda3748', 'message': "Create /var/log/pacemaker/pacemaker.log inside HA OCF containers

commit_message:
Create /var/log/pacemaker/pacemaker.log inside HA OCF containers

Currently on pcmk2.0 we seem to get the following error:

  May 21 14:02:50 controller-0 pacemaker-remoted[8]: error:
    Directory '/var/log/pacemaker' does not exist: logging to
    '/var/log/pacemaker/pacemaker.log' is disabled

Let's make sure we create that file inside the container so
pacemaker_remote can log correctly.  Note: This only affects HA
containers that have a pacemaker_remote running inside (i.e. those that
use an OCF resource agent): redis, rabbit, galera and ovn-dbs.

Co-Authored-By: Damien Ciabrini <dciabrin@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Ia4c3f185b174d5315d1facdaf174e3ad170a21e2
Closes-Bug: #1830160
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/81/660881/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - dest: '/var/log/pacemaker/pacemaker.log' owner: root perm: '0644' merge: false source: '/dev/null'

commit_message:
WIP Retry backup_cib()

Do not fail if backup_cib fails. Especially with remotes it might take
a bit of time to be able to access the cluster's CIB.

Change-Id: I8d6cac3fc2c74091afae8ba09a210cdbc1d93717
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-pacemaker refs/changes/11/618011/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # If an error occurred it returns nil Puppet.debug("backup_cib: Running: #{cmd} failed with code: #{ret.exitstatus} -> #{output}") return nil cib = backup_cib() # if backup_cib() failed, we let the usual retry/sleep loop take place if cib != nil pcs_out = `#{PCS_BIN} -f #{cib} #{cmd} 2>&1` if name.include?('show') delete_cib(cib) # return output for good exit or false for failure. return $?.exitstatus == 0 ? pcs_out : false end if $?.exitstatus == 0 # If push_cib failed, we stay in the loop and keep trying if push_cib(cib) == 0 sleep post_success_sleep return pcs_out end raise Puppet::Error, "pcmk_get_bundle_storage_map backup_cib() failed" if cib == nil raise Puppet::Error, "pcmk_resource_has_changed? backup_cib() failed" if cib == nil raise Puppet::Error, "pcmk_update_resource backup_cib() failed" if cib == nil
deleted_lines: msg = "backup_cib: Running: #{cmd} failed with code: #{ret.exitstatus} -> #{output}" raise Puppet::Error, msg cib = backup_cib() pcs_out = `#{PCS_BIN} -f #{cib} #{cmd} 2>&1` if name.include?('show') delete_cib(cib) # return output for good exit or false for failure. return $?.exitstatus == 0 ? pcs_out : false end if $?.exitstatus == 0 # If push_cib failed, we stay in the loop and keep trying if push_cib(cib) == 0 sleep post_success_sleep return pcs_out

commit_message:
WIP Disable legacy iptable kernel modules when on RHEL8

WIP just a quick test for now

Change-Id: Ibb1b2a7b852ca3b70b114db1f84db7ac7b92b714
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/71/637171/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # See https://tickets.puppetlabs.com/browse/MODULES-8543 - name: Blacklist legacy puppet modules when we are on RHEL 8 #when: ansible_os_family == 'RedHat' and ansible_distribution_version == '8' lineinfile: path: /etc/modprobe.d/blacklist-legacy-iptables.conf create: yes line: "blacklist {{ item }}" with_items: - iptable_nat - iptable_raw - iptable_mangle - iptable_security - iptable_filter - ip6table_nat - ip6table_raw - ip6table_mangle - ip6table_security - ip6table_filter - arptable_filter - ebtable_nat - ebtable_filter - ebtable_broute

commit_message:
WIP Simplify and make defaults for pcmk overridable

Let's unify the defaults setting code between non-IHA deploys and IHA
ones.

Change-Id: I1ce7cbac9c5512bf84845eefb71f608f02078071
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo refs/changes/04/664604/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # [*pcmk_defaults*] # (Optional) Hash to allow overriding pacemaker default settings # Defaults to undef # $pcmk_defaults = undef, $instance_ha_pcmk_defaults = { 'fencing-default' => { name => 'requires', value => 'fencing', }, } } else { $instance_ha_pcmk_defaults = {} $pcmk_defaults = { 'op-start' => { name => 'op monitor', value => '60s', }, } $pcmk_defaults_real = merge($pcmk_defaults, $instance_ha_pcmk_defaults) class { '::pacemaker::resource_defaults': tries => $pcs_tries, defaults => $pcmk_defaults_real,

'}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2019-07-25 21:05:44.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/1a3c6dd542987205fed3dc8621588cba533c05ed', 'message': "[WIP] Functional test for NUMA live migration

This patch add a functional tests for NUMA live migration. It also
adds all the previously missing scaffolding, specifically:

* Remove all the serial elements from fakelibvirt's XMLDesc(), as they
are malformed and not used by anything. They would have caused
problems in libvirt.migration's _update_serial_xml().

* Make the fakelibvirt Domain support the vcpupin, memnode and
emulatorpin XML elements.

* Modifiy how HostInfo and NUMAHostInfo are built to support NUMA
nodes with different numbers of CPUs.

* Factor out creating compute hosts with differing NUMA
topologies. This was originally inline in
test_cold_migrate_with_physnet_fails(), and is needed for NUMA LM func
tests, so it's moved to the base libvirt functional test class.

* Factor out _run_periodics() into the InstanceHelperMixin.

Implements blueprint numa-aware-live-migration
Change-Id: Ia3d7351c1805d98bcb799ab0375673c7f1cb8848
"}, {'number': 5, 'created': '2019-07-26 04:49:20.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/1d6550e3c59ccfd8699ff658ef2085efc79da704', 'message': "[WIP] Functional test for NUMA live migration

This patch add a functional tests for NUMA live migration. It also
adds all the previously missing scaffolding, specifically:

* Remove all the serial elements from fakelibvirt's XMLDesc(), as they
are malformed and not used by anything. They would have caused
problems in libvirt.migration's _update_serial_xml().

* Make the fakelibvirt Domain support the vcpupin, memnode and
emulatorpin XML elements.

* Modifiy how HostInfo and NUMAHostInfo are built to support NUMA
nodes with different numbers of CPUs.

* Factor out creating compute hosts with differing NUMA topologies.
This was originally inline in test_cold_migrate_with_physnet_fails(),
and is needed for NUMA LM func tests, so it's moved to the base
libvirt functional test class. The refactor also fixes a lambda
scoping issue, see the inline comment for lambda scoping fun.

* Factor out _run_periodics() into the InstanceHelperMixin.

Implements blueprint numa-aware-live-migration
Change-Id: Ia3d7351c1805d98bcb799ab0375673c7f1cb8848
"}, {'number': 6, 'created': '2019-07-26 20:42:57.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/7d8918a3488383f98c5ec92c44a146e2e0cfa727', 'message': "[WIP] Functional test for NUMA live migration

This patch add a functional tests for NUMA live migration. It also
adds all the previously missing scaffolding, specifically:

* The serial elements in fakelibvirt's XMLDesc() are malformed. They
are enough to pass existing unit tests, but would break
migration._update_serial_xml(). This patch removes unused elements,
and makes the remaining element's presence conditional to
CONF.serial_console.enabled being set - which is how serial consoles
actually work. This allows tests that don't set serial_console =
enabled (like the new NUMA LM func test) to not have to deal with the
broken serial XML, while tests that relied on it in the past now just
set serial_console = enabled.

* Make the fakelibvirt Domain support the vcpupin, memnode and
emulatorpin XML elements.

* Modifiy how HostInfo and NUMAHostInfo are built to support NUMA
nodes with different numbers of CPUs.

* Factor out creating compute hosts with differing NUMA topologies.
This was originally inline in test_cold_migrate_with_physnet_fails(),
and is needed for NUMA LM func tests, so it's moved to the base
libvirt functional test class. The refactor also fixes a lambda
scoping issue, see the inline comment for lambda scoping fun.

* _run_periodics() from ProviderUsageBaseTestCase is needed in the new
NUMA LM func test class. Since the latter cannot inherit from
ProviderUsageBaseTestCase, _run_periodics() is factored out into a new
ServicesHelperMixin.

Implements blueprint numa-aware-live-migration
Change-Id: Ia3d7351c1805d98bcb799ab0375673c7f1cb8848
"}, {'number': 7, 'created': '2019-07-29 21:22:16.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/c5d41827d95a90d7a007d65f7e241bf2196599df', 'message': "[WIP] Functional test for NUMA live migration

"}, {'number': 10, 'created': '2019-08-22 21:21:24.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/08f88f19cc8da4e04ef7ef6389f751d653bf607c', 'message': "[WIP] Functional test for NUMA live migration

This patch add a functional tests for NUMA live migration. It also
adds all the previously missing scaffolding, specifically:

* The serial elements in fakelibvirt's XMLDesc() are malformed. They
are enough to pass existing unit tests, but would break
migration._update_serial_xml(). This patch removes unused elements,
and makes the remaining element's presence conditional to
CONF.serial_console.enabled being set - which is how serial consoles
actually work. This allows tests that don't set serial_console =
enabled (like the new NUMA LM func test) to not have to deal with the
broken serial XML, while tests that relied on it in the past now just
set serial_console = enabled.

* Make the fakelibvirt Domain support the vcpupin, memnode and
emulatorpin XML elements.

* Modifiy how HostInfo and NUMAHostInfo are built to support NUMA
nodes with different numbers of CPUs.

* Factor out creating compute hosts with differing NUMA topologies.
This was originally inline in test_cold_migrate_with_physnet_fails(),
and is needed for NUMA LM func tests, so it's moved to the base
libvirt functional test class. The refactor also fixes a lambda
scoping issue, see the inline comment for lambda scoping fun.

* _run_periodics() from ProviderUsageBaseTestCase is needed in the new
NUMA LM func test class. Since the latter cannot inherit from
ProviderUsageBaseTestCase, _run_periodics() is factored out into a new
ServicesHelperMixin.

Implements blueprint numa-aware-live-migration
Change-Id: Ia3d7351c1805d98bcb799ab0375673c7f1cb8848

"}, {'number': 26, 'created': '2019-09-01 13:02:01.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/92e0f8a639a57a08e25158929a1573a30944e851', 'message': "Functional tests for NUMA live migration

This patch add a functional tests for NUMA live migration. It also
adds all the previously missing scaffolding, specifically:

* The serial elements in fakelibvirt's XMLDesc() are malformed. They
are enough to pass existing unit tests, but would break
migration._update_serial_xml(). This patch removes unused elements,
and makes the remaining element's presence conditional to
CONF.serial_console.enabled being set - which is how serial consoles
actually work. This allows tests that don't set serial_console =
enabled (like the new NUMA LM func test) to not have to deal with the
broken serial XML, while tests that relied on it in the past now just
set serial_console = enabled.

* Make the fakelibvirt Domain support the vcpupin, memnode and
emulatorpin XML elements.

* Modifiy how HostInfo is built to support NUMA nodes with different
numbers of CPUs.

* Factor out creating compute hosts with differing NUMA topologies.
This was originally inline in test_cold_migrate_with_physnet_fails(),
and is needed for NUMA LM func tests, so it's moved to the base
libvirt functional test class. The refactor also fixes a lambda
scoping issue, see the inline comment for lambda scoping fun.

* _run_periodics() from ProviderUsageBaseTestCase is needed in the new
NUMA LM func test class. Since the latter cannot inherit from
ProviderUsageBaseTestCase, _run_periodics() is factored out into a new
ServicesHelperMixin.

Implements blueprint numa-aware-live-migration
Change-Id: Ia3d7351c1805d98bcb799ab0375673c7f1cb8848

CONF.serial_console.enabled being set - which is how serial consoles
actually work. This allows tests that don't set serial_console =
enabled (like the new NUMA LM func test) to not have to deal with the
broken serial XML, while tests that relied on it in the past now just
set serial_console = enabled.

* Make the fakelibvirt Domain support the vcpupin, memnode and
emulatorpin XML elements.

* Modifiy how HostInfo is built to support NUMA nodes with different
numbers of CPUs.

* Factor out creating compute hosts with differing NUMA topologies.
This was originally inline in test_cold_migrate_with_physnet_fails(),
and is needed for NUMA LM func tests, so it's moved to the base
libvirt functional test class. The refactor also fixes a lambda
scoping issue, see the inline comment for lambda scoping fun.

* _run_periodics() from ProviderUsageBaseTestCase is needed in the new
NUMA LM func test class. Since the latter cannot inherit from
ProviderUsageBaseTestCase, _run_periodics() is factored out into a new
ServicesHelperMixin.

Implements blueprint numa-aware-live-migration
Change-Id: Ia3d7351c1805d98bcb799ab0375673c7f1cb8848

"}, {'number': 49, 'created': '2019-09-11 01:35:27.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/90004224f049c57eb85d82ebf1ab952516afd6eb', 'message': 'Functional tests for NUMA live migration

This patch add a functional tests for NUMA live migration. It also
adds all the previously missing scaffolding, specifically:

* In order to test a particular situation (details in NOTEs inline)
around saving an instance, we need to pretend that the two computes do
not have shared storage and do a block migration. We do some
monkeypatching to fake this (again, see NOTEs inline), but also add
support for creating fake instance "disks" in fakelibvirt.

* The serial elements in fakelibvirt's XMLDesc() are malformed. They
are enough to pass existing unit tests, but would break
migration._update_serial_xml(). This patch removes unused elements,
and makes the remaining element's presence conditional to
CONF.serial_console.enabled being set - which is how serial consoles
actually work. This allows tests that don't set serial_console =
enabled (like the new NUMA LM func test) to not have to deal with the
broken serial XML, while tests that relied on it in the past now just
set serial_console = enabled.

* Make the fakelibvirt Domain support the vcpupin, memnode and
emulatorpin XML elements.

* Modifiy how HostInfo is built to support NUMA nodes with different
numbers of CPUs.

* Factor out creating compute hosts with differing NUMA topologies.
This was originally inline in test_cold_migrate_with_physnet_fails(),
and is needed for NUMA LM func tests, so it's moved to the base
libvirt functional test class. The refactor also fixes a lambda
scoping issue, see the inline comment for lambda scoping fun.

* _run_periodics() from ProviderUsageBaseTestCase is needed in the new
NUMA LM func test class. Since the latter cannot inherit from
ProviderUsageBaseTestCase, _run_periodics() is factored out into a new
ServicesHelperMixin.

Implements blueprint numa-aware-live-migration
Change-Id: Ia3d7351c1805d98bcb799ab0375673c7f1cb8848

and makes the remaining element's presence conditional to
CONF.serial_console.enabled being set - which is how serial consoles
actually work. This allows tests that don't set serial_console =
enabled (like the new NUMA LM func test) to not have to deal with the
broken serial XML, while tests that relied on it in the past now just
set serial_console = enabled.

* Make the fakelibvirt Domain support the vcpupin, memnode and
emulatorpin XML elements.

* Modifiy how HostInfo is built to support NUMA nodes with different
numbers of CPUs.

* _run_periodics() from ProviderUsageBaseTestCase is needed in the new
NUMA LM func test class. Since the latter cannot inherit from
ProviderUsageBaseTestCase, _run_periodics() is factored out into a new
ServicesHelperMixin.

Implements blueprint numa-aware-live-migration
Change-Id: Ia3d7351c1805d98bcb799ab0375673c7f1cb8848

"}, {'number': 58, 'created': '2019-10-24 17:35:27.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/29e8d33f8e411f4b4d5e0ab9d1170be6fa4ed4ff', 'message': "Functional tests for NUMA live migration

This patch add a functional tests for NUMA live migration. It also
adds all the previously missing scaffolding, specifically:

* The serial elements in fakelibvirt's XMLDesc() are malformed. They
  are enough to pass existing unit tests, but would break
  migration._update_serial_xml(). This patch removes unused elements,
  and makes the remaining element's presence conditional to
  CONF.serial_console.enabled being set - which is how serial consoles
  actually work. This allows tests that don't set serial_console =
  enabled (like the new NUMA LM func test) to not have to deal with
  the broken serial XML, while tests that relied on it in the past now
  just set serial_console = enabled.

* Make the fakelibvirt Domain support the vcpupin, memnode and
  emulatorpin XML elements.

* Modify how HostInfo is built to support NUMA nodes with different
  numbers of CPUs.

* _run_periodics() from ProviderUsageBaseTestCase is needed in the new
  NUMA LM func test class. Since the latter cannot inherit from
  ProviderUsageBaseTestCase, _run_periodics() is factored out into a
  new ServicesHelperMixin.

* To support testing RPC pinning, a new StubComputeRPCAPI is added to
  the integrated helpers. It replaces the real ComputeAPI's router()
  method with a stub that uses the RPC version set by the object's
  __init__. Tests can replace a real ComputeAPI object with the Stub
  to simulate compute services and/or conductors being pinned to
  different RPC versions.

Implements blueprint numa-aware-live-migration
Change-Id: Ia3d7351c1805d98bcb799ab0375673c7f1cb8848

"}, {'number': 62, 'created': '2020-01-17 21:22:39.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/7ccaebe46744fc95bdc1da28973ba033edad1722', 'message': "Functional tests for NUMA live migration

This patch add a functional tests for NUMA live migration. It also
adds all the previously missing scaffolding, specifically:

* The serial elements in fakelibvirt's XMLDesc() are malformed. They
  are enough to pass existing unit tests, but would break
  migration._update_serial_xml(). This patch removes unused elements,
  and makes the remaining element's presence conditional to
  CONF.serial_console.enabled being set - which is how serial consoles
  actually work. This allows tests that don't set serial_console =
  enabled (like the new NUMA LM func test) to not have to deal with
  the broken serial XML, while tests that relied on it in the past now
  just set serial_console = enabled.

* Make the fakelibvirt Domain support the vcpupin, memnode and
  emulatorpin XML elements.

* Modify how HostInfo is built to support NUMA nodes with different
  numbers of CPUs.

* _run_periodics() from ProviderUsageBaseTestCase is needed in the new
  NUMA LM func test class. Since the latter cannot inherit from
  ProviderUsageBaseTestCase, _run_periodics() is factored out into a
  new ServicesHelperMixin.

* To support testing RPC pinning, a new StubComputeRPCAPI is added to
  the integrated helpers. It replaces the real ComputeAPI's router()
  method with a stub that uses the RPC version set by the object's
  __init__. Tests can replace a real ComputeAPI object with the Stub
  to simulate compute services and/or conductors being pinned to
  different RPC versions.

* In the fake_imagebackend, the image_init() method that stubs in for
  a Backend needs fake is_shared_block_storage() and
  is_file_in_instance_path() methods. Those get called indirectly from
  the _check_can_live_migrate_(source|destination) checks.

Implements blueprint numa-aware-live-migration
Change-Id: Ia3d7351c1805d98bcb799ab0375673c7f1cb8848
"}, {'number': 63, 'created': '2020-01-30 00:11:49.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/749efeb74acc7f25124ab80322f3751ef7057070', 'message': "Functional tests for NUMA live migration

This patch add a functional tests for NUMA live migration. It also
adds all the previously missing scaffolding, specifically:

* The serial elements in fakelibvirt's XMLDesc() are malformed. They
  are enough to pass existing unit tests, but would break
  migration._update_serial_xml(). This patch removes unused elements,
  and makes the remaining element's presence conditional to

  just set serial_console = enabled.

* Make the fakelibvirt Domain support the vcpupin, memnode and
  emulatorpin XML elements.

* Turn fakelibvirt's HostInfo into a wrapper around a new
  CustomHostInfo, which supports NUMA nodes with different numbers of
  CPUs.

* _run_periodics() from ProviderUsageBaseTestCase is needed in the new
  NUMA LM func test class. Since the latter cannot inherit from
  ProviderUsageBaseTestCase, _run_periodics() is factored out into a

  different RPC versions.

* In the fake_imagebackend, the image_init() method that stubs in for
  a Backend needs fake is_shared_block_storage() and
  is_file_in_instance_path() methods. Those get called indirectly from
  the _check_can_live_migrate_(source|destination) checks.

Implements blueprint numa-aware-live-migration
Change-Id: Ia3d7351c1805d98bcb799ab0375673c7f1cb8848

commit_message:
Functional tests for NUMA live migration

This patch add a functional tests for NUMA live migration. It also
adds all the previously missing scaffolding, specifically:

* Make the fakelibvirt Domain support the vcpupin, memnode and
  emulatorpin XML elements.

* To support testing RPC pinning, a new StubComputeRPCAPI is added to
  the integrated helpers. It replaces the real ComputeAPI's router()
  method with a stub that uses the RPC version set by the object's
  __init__. Tests can replace a real ComputeAPI object with the Stub
  to simulate compute services and/or conductors being pinned to
  different RPC versions.

* In the fake_imagebackend, is_shared_block_storage() gets stubbed.
  It's called indirectly from the
  _check_can_live_migrate_(source|destination) checks.

Implements blueprint numa-aware-live-migration
Change-Id: Ia3d7351c1805d98bcb799ab0375673c7f1cb8848

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-10-08 19:36:24.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/a1337c1614dc2c3b56738f3eb5de9188a7eb9a84', 'message': "[WIP] NUMA LM: Add func test for bug 1845146

Bug 1845146 was caused by the update available resources periodic task
running during a small window in which the migration was in 'accepted'
but resource claims had been done. 'accepted' migrations were not
considered in progress before the fix for 1845146 merged as commit
6ec686c26b, which caused the periodic task to incorrectly free the
migration's resources from the destination. This patch adds a test
that triggers this race by wrapping around the compute manager's
_do_live_migration() (which sets the 'preparing' migration status) and
running the update available resources periodic task while the
migration is still in 'accepted'.

Related bug: 1845146

commit_message:
NUMA LM: Add func test for bug 1845146

Bug 1845146 was caused by the update available resources periodic task
running during a small window in which the migration was in 'accepted'
but resource claims had been done. 'accepted' migrations were not
considered in progress before the fix for 1845146 merged as commit
6ec686c26b, which caused the periodic task to incorrectly free the
migration's resources from the destination. This patch adds a test
that triggers this race by wrapping around the compute manager's
live_migration() (which sets the 'queued' migration status - this was
actually wrong in 6ec686c26b, as it talks about 'preparing') and
running the update available resources periodic task while the
migration is still in 'accepted'.

Related bug: 1845146

Change-Id: I78e79112a9c803fb45d828cfb4641456da66364a

added_lines: from nova.compute import manager as compute_manager def _live_migrate_server2(self, server2, expected_host, pin_dest=False): """Live migrate server2, making sure it moved to the expected host. :param expected_host: The hostname where the server should end up. If the caller expects the migration to succeed, this should be the destination, otherwise this is the source. source = self._get_host(server2['id']) dest = 'host3' if source == 'host2' else 'host2' self.assertEqual(expected_host, self._get_host(server2['id'])) self.server2_final_host = ( 'host3' if server2_initial_host == 'host2' else 'host2') self._live_migrate_server2(self.server2, self.server2_final_host, pin_dest=pin_dest) self._check_server2_pinned_cpus(self.server2['id'], self.server2_final_host) self._check_hosts_pinned_cpus(self.server2_final_host) self._check_hosts_pinned_cpus(self.server2_final_host) def test_bug_1843639(self): orig_do_live_migration = \ compute_manager.ComputeManager._do_live_migration def do_live_migration(*args, **kwargs): self._run_pediodics() self._check_server2_pinned_cpus(self.server2['id'], self.server2_final_host) self._check_hosts_pinned_cpus(self.server2_final_host) return orig_do_live_migration(*args, **kwargs) self.useFixture(fixtures.MonkeyPatch( 'nova.compute.manager.ComputeManager._do_live_migration', do_live_migration)) self._test() server2_final_host = ( 'host2' if server2_initial_host == 'host2' else 'host3') self._live_migrate_server2(self.server2, server2_final_host, pin_dest=pin_dest)
deleted_lines: def _live_migrate_server2(self, server2, expect_success=True, pin_dest=False): """Live migrate server2, making sure it moved to the expected host. If expect_success is False, that host is the same as the initial host. :param expect_success: True if the live migration should complete, false if we expect it to rollback. source = self._get_host(server2['id']) dest = 'host3' if source == 'host2' else 'host2' self.server2_final_host = dest if expect_success else source self.assertEqual(self.server2_final_host, self._get_host(server2['id'])) return self.server2_final_host server2_final_host = self._live_migrate_server2(self.server2, pin_dest=pin_dest) self._check_server2_pinned_cpus(self.server2['id'], server2_final_host) self._check_hosts_pinned_cpus(server2_final_host) self._check_hosts_pinned_cpus(server2_final_host) server2_final_host = self._live_migrate_server2(self.server2, expect_success=False, pin_dest=pin_dest)

commit_message:
Skip rescue BFV instance tests

Nova implemented the feature for rescuing the BFV instances.
- https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/ussuri/approved/virt-bfv-instance-rescue.html

It is not working with ceph backend as new tests added in Tempest are failing ceph job

Related-Bug: #1876330

commit_message:
[devstack][ci] Modify firewall in ds-plugin

To set up some first party backends such as
ZFSOnLinux, CephFS via NFS gateway, Container
(where the NAS server is containerized) and LVM,
manila's devstack plugin creates a NAS server
on the devstack host.

On test machines, access to this NAS server is
firewalled from networks outside of the host's
internal network namespace (including from private
project networks that are in different network
namespaces, on the same devstack host).

We currently use a legacy devstack-gate script
to disable firewall on NFS ports; however,
anyone that installs devstack with LVM, Container,
ZFSOnLinux, CephFS-NFS drivers will need these
firewall ports to be opened to be able to mount
shares exported off their devstack host machines.

Move these firewall commands to the devstack plugin.
These commands can be invoked by setting the localrc
variable MANILA_ALLOW_NAS_SERVER_PORTS_ON_HOST to True.
The value of this variable is False by default,
to preserve existing behavior.

Change-Id: Ic9cad47662f1edf2e5c710dbe64d580bc5f01d44

commit_message:
WIP Enable stonith at step2

In the past when every openstack service was controlled by pacemaker
enabling stonith right away was a bit risky as it might have triggered
stonith actions in case of issues. This should not really be the case
anymore since we manage only a handful of services via pacemaker.

Change-Id: I93f05f44e884baf45980af32045101ec04dd6175

commit_message:
WIP disable nova_api rabbitmq heartbeats

nova api's use of eventlet and wsgi makes the heartbeat thread a
greenthread which does not get scheduled enough and so nova api +
rabbitmq log a lot of heartbeat connection missed errors. For now we
disable this only for nova_api and we solely rely on our tcp keepalive
settings for connection aliveness towards rabbitmq.

WIP just a placeholder for now, as we need to smoketest this and add
proper bugs/explanation

Change-Id: I0afddc38774a2c3debc5aed821409f3f44ed8c84
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/43/661343/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add openvswitch into to_remove/to_install Leapp files.

Queens uses openvswitch2.11, while Train works on openvswitch2.13. We require leapp
to do the versions switch during the operating system upgrade so we leverage from
the reboot taking place during the operating system upgrade to change from ovs2.11
to ovs2.13.

If not done, the very first packages update will fail as ovs2.11 is mutually exclusive
with ovs2.13.

Change-Id: I5e9248a5eddf2c17625926f74398528a40d3f49c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-upgrade refs/changes/96/721996/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: Add openvswitch into leapp's to_remove/to_install files lineinfile: path: "/etc/leapp/transaction/{{ item.file }}" line: "{{ item.package }}" loop: - { file: 'to_remove', package: 'openvswitch2.11' } - { file: 'to_install', package: 'openvswitch2.13' }

commit_message:
docs: Mention other ways of escaping '$'

oslo config code treat treats the '$' as a special character and it
needs to be delimited when using within a string. There are two ways of
doing this, '$$' or '\$'. We document the former but not the latter. Fix
this.

Change-Id: I37cdf31ba1c2924779a46b1a2eeabb66c46a2212
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1872839
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.config refs/changes/67/724867/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: To avoid substitution, escape the ``$`` with ``$$`` or ``\$``.
deleted_lines: To avoid substitution, use ``$$``, it is replaced by a single ``$``.

commit_message:
Allow read-only Commands to bypass txns in execute()

This patch continues https://review.opendev.org/#/c/633070/.

Since the ovs_idl backend maintains an in-memory copy of the DB,
read-only commands can be executed w/o creating a transaction.
Since it is possible for a function that calls execute() to be
automatically nested into an existing transaction, execute()
wasn't able to access the result since it only happens once the
parent transaction completed. Handling these read-only commands
w/o creating a transaction allows the results to be read and
avoids wasting resources by creating needless transactions.

ReadOnlyCommands can still be used in with transaction(): blocks
with no changes.

Change-Id: Ic3f7cd5733b7a28acc74345e7faa182ebd3a69b0
Closes-Bug: #1873305
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ovsdbapp refs/changes/47/722347/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Allow read-only Commands to bypass txns in execute()

This patch continues https://review.opendev.org/#/c/633070/.

Since the ovs_idl backend maintains an in-memory copy of the DB,
read-only commands can be executed w/o creating a transaction.
Since it is possible for a function that calls execute() to be
automatically nested into an existing transaction, execute()
wasn't able to access the result since it only happens once the
parent transaction completed. Handling these read-only commands
w/o creating a transaction allows the results to be read and
avoids wasting resources by creating needless transactions.

ReadOnlyCommands can still be used in with transaction(): blocks
with no changes.

Change-Id: Ic3f7cd5733b7a28acc74345e7faa182ebd3a69b0
Closes-Bug: #1873305

commit_message:
Add contributor doc policy

This is the first step of completing the contributor doc goal[0] from
the Ussuri cycle. It adds a contributing.rst policy which uses the
cookiecutter template created for the goal.

The expectation is that this is a central location for all of this
information, and the contributing.rst in each Oslo project will
simply refer to it so we aren't maintaining it in 40+ repos.

0: https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/project-ptl-and-contrib-docs.html

Change-Id: I3347d553b50a52ae96186e60b729360b159d8df5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo-specs refs/changes/44/723044/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ============================ So You Want to Contribute... ============================ For general information on contributing to OpenStack, please check out the `contributor guide <https://docs.openstack.org/contributors/>`_ to get started. It covers all the basics that are common to all OpenStack projects: the accounts you need, the basics of interacting with our Gerrit review system, how we communicate as a community, etc. Below will cover the more project specific information you need to get started with Oslo, which includes all of the projects listed on `the Oslo wiki <https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Oslo#Libraries>`_. Communication ~~~~~~~~~~~~~ IRC: #openstack-oslo on Freenode Mailing list: Messages tagged with [oslo] on `openstack-discuss <http://lists.openstack.org/cgi-bin/mailman/listinfo/openstack-discuss>`_ Meeting: Weekly. Full details on `eavesdrop <http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/#Oslo_Team_Meeting>`_ Contacting the Core Team ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ .. TODO(bnemec): I think we should keep this list on the wiki so cores can update their own details without waiting for reviews. .. This section should list the core team, their irc nicks, emails, timezones etc. If all this info is maintained elsewhere (i.e. a wiki), you can link to that instead of enumerating everyone here. New Feature Planning ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Oslo uses a spec process for major new features. See details `on the wiki <https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Oslo#Design_Proposals>`_. Task Tracking ~~~~~~~~~~~~~ We track our tasks in Launchpad. https://bugs.launchpad.net/oslo Each individual library also has its own Launchpad project. If you're looking for some smaller, easier work item to pick up and get started on, search for the 'low-hanging-fruit' tag. Reporting a Bug ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ You found an issue and want to make sure we are aware of it? You can do so on `Launchpad <https://bugs.launchpad.net/oslo>`_. Getting Your Patch Merged ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ In general, Oslo requires 2 +2's in order to merge a patch. Under some circumstances a single +2 may be sufficient. This is generally reserved for repetitive patches such as trivial tox changes that have been pre-approved by the team. Some other circumstances (such as gate blocking bugs) may call for single approval at the discretion of the core team. Unit tests are preferred for changes that are not already covered by existing unit tests, and will usually help patches merge more quickly. Project Team Lead Duties ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ PTL duties are documented in the `Oslo PTL Guide <https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/oslo-specs/specs/policy/ptl.html>`_. All common PTL duties are enumerated in the `PTL guide <https://docs.openstack.org/project-team-guide/ptl.html>`_.

commit_message:
Add details about the different templates

There are three different templates people may need to use when
opening an oslo spec. We should explain that in the readme.

Change-Id: I720bab01196469a7759c9fa01e59c9735b12e628
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo-specs refs/changes/43/723043/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: There are three templates from which to start a spec, depending on what you are proposing: * If you are proposing a completely new library: `new-library-template.rst <https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo-specs/src/branch/master/specs/new-library-template.rst>`_ * If you are proposing a new policy for Oslo: `policy-template.rst <https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo-specs/src/branch/master/specs/policy-template.rst>`_ * If you are proposing any other major feature: `template.rst <https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo-specs/src/branch/master/specs/template.rst>`_
deleted_lines: .. Change things from this point on

commit_message:
NetApp SolidFire: Fix pylint issues

This patch fixes pylint issues in both solidfire and test_solidfire
modules. New SolidFire patches shall succeed pylint checks.

Change-Id: I6695dbd0e0ae22cc4a820b3b6c179a13ace8a51a
(cherry picked from commit c91ef97096151846408a5a77ad71638651544d58)

commit_message:
Remove graduation-template.rst

Incubator hasn't been a thing for a long time now. There are no more
graduations happening, so we don't need this template.

Change-Id: Ic90eb209291db40c9fe58747bf00b6b6d67a10bd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo-specs refs/changes/42/723042/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: .. This template should be in ReSTructured text. For help with syntax, see http://sphinx-doc.org/rest.html To test out your formatting, build the docs using tox, or see: http://rst.ninjs.org The filename in the git repository should match the launchpad URL, for example a URL of https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo?searchtext=awesome-thing should be named awesome-thing.rst. Wrap text at 79 columns. Do not delete any of the sections in this template. If you have nothing to say for a whole section, just write: None If you would like to provide a diagram with your spec, ascii diagrams are required. http://asciiflow.com/ is a very nice tool to assist with making ascii diagrams. The reason for this is that the tool used to review specs is based purely on plain text. Plain text will allow review to proceed without having to look at additional files which can not be viewed in gerrit. It will also allow inline feedback on the diagram itself. ============================= Graduating X ============================= Include the URL of your launchpad blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo?searchtext=graduate-example Provide a brief description of the focus of the new library. Library Name ============ What is the name of the new library?: Refer to https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Oslo/CreatingANewLibrary#Choosing_a_Name for the policies related to Oslo library names. Contents ======== List the files to be included in the new library, using their existing incubator names. Early Adopters ============== List the projects that have agreed to participate as early adopters of the new library. Public API ========== Describe the public API of the new library (modules and functions). Include details about any functions in the modules now that will be considered private, and that may need to move into a private module to stay hidden. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Who is handling the graduation work? If more than one person is working on the implementation, please designate the primary author and contact. Primary assignee: <launchpad-id or None> Other contributors: <launchpad-id or None> Primary Maintainer ------------------ Each graduated library needs a primary maintainer. That may be the same person who started the code, the person who graduated it, or it may be someone who is taking over maintenance duties. If more than one person *who is not already on the oslo-core team* intends to participate as a core reviewer for the new library, list them under "Other Contributors". Primary Maintainer: <launchpad-id or None> Other Contributors: <launchpad-id or None> Security Contact ---------------- Each graduated library needs a contact for the OpenStack Vulnerability Management team. It may be the same as the primary maintainer, an existing Oslo team member who helps with security issues, or it may be someone else on the development team for the new library. Talk with the Oslo and Vulnerability management teams about who the person is, and make sure they agree to their participation before proceeding. Security Contact: <launchpad-id or None> Milestones ---------- Target Milestone for completion: Work Items ---------- Start with https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Oslo/CreatingANewLibrary#Checklist and add any additional steps necessary at the appropriate place in the sequence. If no extra work is needed, referencing the checklist without reproducing it is sufficient. Link to any blueprints that need to be completed in the incubator before the library can be graduated. Describe any organizational or API changes to the code that need to be made after the code is moved to its new repository but before the library can be considered ready for use. Complex changes should be separate blueprints. Adoption Notes ============== In this section, provide any advice possible to make adopting the new library easier. Will the library will behave differently than the incubated code in some significant way? Will it need specific integration work across all projects (e.g., creating an integration module to hold globals)? Dependencies ============ - Include specific references to specs and/or blueprints in oslo, or in other projects, that this one either depends on or is related to. - Does this feature require any new library dependencies or code otherwise not included in OpenStack? Or does it depend on a specific version of library? References ========== Please add any useful references here. You are not required to have any reference. Moreover, this specification should still make sense when your references are unavailable. Examples of what you could include are: * Links to mailing list or IRC discussions * Links to notes from a summit session * Links to relevant research, if appropriate * Related specifications as appropriate (e.g. if it's an EC2 thing, link the EC2 docs) * Anything else you feel it is worthwhile to refer to .. note:: This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I065a146c0041386ddc14d3cb07fa4510f8af5650

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-04-02 07:27:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/glance_store/commit/549397f876ba915f076e62b352e794d42c891851', 'message': 'Add lock per share for  cinder nfs mount

With cinder configured as glance store and nfs as cinder backend,
if we create multiple images concurrently into the same share,
there might be race conditions.
This patch ensures a lock per export to avoid the race conditions.

Closes-Bug: #1870289

With cinder configured as glance store and nfs as cinder backend,
if we create multiple images concurrently into the same share,
there might be race conditions.
This patch ensures a lock per export to avoid the race conditions.

This patch also introduces a reference counting mechamism for unmounting

commit_message:
Add lock per share for cinder nfs mount/umount

With cinder configured as glance store and nfs as cinder backend,
if we create multiple images concurrently into the same share,
there might be race conditions.
This patch ensures a lock per export to avoid the race conditions.

This patch also introduces a reference counting mechamism for unmounting
which will unmount the share if no active thread/process is using it.

Closes-Bug: #1870289

Change-Id: I9197f64e29a0ae2e0a58186f1a70aa134f7f1db6

commit_message:
Add Prelude for Ussuri release notes.

It should be proposed before stable/ussuri branch was created but
unfortunatelly I forgot about it.
So now, the new release notes with prelude section for Ussuri is added
to the master branch and added to be ignored in Victoria's release
notes.
This patch will also be cherry-picked to the stable/ussuri branch so it
will be displayed in Ussuri's release notes properly.

Change-Id: I425167223a4136be9d12bac16f20104a1bbe4595
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/09/724809/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- prelude: | The 16.0.0 release includes many bug fixes and new features. The most important improvements worth mentioning are: - Python 2 is no longer supported by Neutron, Python 3.6 and 3.7 are. - Address scopes and subnetpools can now be shared with other tenants using Role Based Access Controll (``RBAC``) mechanism. - Security groups can now be set as ``statefull``. Conntrack will not be used for all rules from such group. This is currently supported only by the ``iptables`` and ``iptables_hybdid`` drivers. - Neutron API allows now to tag resources directly in the ``POST`` request. - IGMP snooping (multicast) can now be enabled in the ``OVS`` and ``OVN`` drivers. - A list of IPv6 addresses for a dhcp-host entry in the dnsmasq DHCP agent driver can be configured. That solves problems with failing boot process when only one IP address is available. See `#1861032 <https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1861032>`_) for details about the issue.

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I225073b4f1c4efc2b70e618c16916296a9640d0f

commit_message:
Don't override default verbose_level

In I35b10d48344c8b7f71186bc529a300f75d7b8d63, we changed to
use verbose_level for playbook verbosity and as result forced
the default client verbosity to 0 and we don't see stack
events like before. This resets it back to 1.

Change-Id: Ibcd15e78aa52cbbc29e7213c04ae63594e2bcc35

subject: WIP Make sure we chown on-disk state folders for cinder/manila via kolla_start
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-07-13 07:06:47.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/83175a68a16ce54cafff97c89ee380db0a78998a', 'message': "WIP Rerun the init_log for cinder/manila every time and also chown state folder

Via 'I9b32890717d7ddebcc282736bee60360834930d4' (cinder-* bundles and
manila-share to not need to be run as root) we want to drop the root
user from those pacemaker bundles. In order to be able to do so we need
to make sure that both log folders *and* on-disk state folders are
chowned to the right user. By doing this we have the following
scenarios:
1) New deploy and bundles running as root
Same as today, bundles run as root and the ownership of logs and state
files is non-root at the start of the deploy but is going to change to
root once the bundle starts.
2) Re-deploy and bundles running as root
Same as new deploy, the *_init_state containers will do the chown to
the non-root user, but then the bundles will just write as user like
before.
3) New deploy and bundles running as non-root
Same as today, except bundles run as non-root and the files will stay
the same
4) Re-deploy and bundles running as non-root
The *_init_state paunch containers will chown files to non-root and
when the bundles restart (due to the change in bundle definition) they
will start as non-root user and the files should be non-root

WIP because we need to discuss this in more detail and because I do
wonder about the following scenario around 4):
4.A) The *_init_state container runs and logs and on-disk state are
chown to non-root
4.B) The bundle gets restarted due to non-root user change, but while
     stopping the service writes some state/logs and closes the files
     as root.
4.C) The bundle starts as non-root, but if the files are now owned by
     root (due to closing via 4.B), things will break

Change-Id: Ia8a87b7dad3b0c2932d8f770d5d76842609a377f
Partial-Bug: #1781534

Same as today, bundles run as root and the ownership of logs and state

The *_init_state paunch containers will chown files to non-root and
when the bundles restart (due to the change in bundle definition) they

We set permissions via the kolla_start mechanism so that there are no
races around changing the permissions and restarting the bundles.

WIP because we need to discuss this in more detail with other

commit_message:
WIP Make sure we chown on-disk state folders for cinder/manila via kolla_start

Via 'I9b32890717d7ddebcc282736bee60360834930d4' (cinder-* bundles and
manila-share do not need to be run as root) we want to drop the root
user from those pacemaker bundles. In order to be able to do so we need
to make sure that both log folders *and* on-disk state folders are
chowned to the right user. By doing this we have the following
scenarios:
1) New deploy and bundles running as root
Same as today, bundles run as root and the ownership of logs and state
files is non-root at the start of the deploy but is going to change to
root once the bundle starts.
2) Re-deploy and bundles running as root
Same as new deploy, the *_init_state containers will do the chown to
the non-root user, but then the bundles will just write as user like
before.
3) New deploy and bundles running as non-root
Same as today, except bundles run as non-root and the files will stay
the same
4) Re-deploy and bundles running as non-root
The *_init_state paunch containers will chown files to non-root and
when the bundles restart (due to the change in bundle definition) they
will start as non-root user and the files should be non-root

We set permissions via the kolla_start mechanism so that there are no
races around changing the permissions and restarting the bundles.

WIP because we need to discuss this a bit more in detail

Change-Id: Ia8a87b7dad3b0c2932d8f770d5d76842609a377f
Partial-Bug: #1781534

subject: WIP Lower case entries in /etc/hosts
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-08-04 13:56:07.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/hosts-config.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/1f6f0077b90dc9bdf6bc98f432aa2686628e2d32', 'message': "WIP Lower case entries in /etc/hosts

It seems at least some components have a hard time dealing
with mixed case /etc/hosts entries. Seen in neutron for example:
2018-08-04 13:01:10.235 122238 ERROR oslo.messaging._drivers.impl_rabbit [req-b6157f9f-faf9-4a18-99ad-5d36d1371713 - - - - -] [f6f92ad8-7a93-4a70-aab3-6720a5eb20d] AMQP server on test-controller-1.internalapi.localdomain:5672 is unreachable: [Errno -2] No address found. Trying again in 1 seconds. Client port: None gaierror: [Errno -2] No address found

The hostname was test-controller-0.localdomain and the entry in
/etc/hosts was the following:
172.17.1.18 TEST-controller-0.internalapi.localdomain TEST-controller-0.internalapi

Let's lowercase all entries in any case.

Reported-By: Marian Krcmari <mkrcmari@redhat.com>

WIP: because we'd first like to fix the libraries that are not able to
cope with this mixed casing

Change-Id: I69474134facbfaa7ca77aab7b98c8a3f4dc83e6a
"}]
commit_message:
WIP Lower case entries in /etc/hosts

It seems at least some components have a hard time dealing
with mixed case /etc/hosts entries. Seen in neutron for example:
2018-08-04 13:01:10.235 122238 ERROR oslo.messaging._drivers.impl_rabbit [req-b6157f9f-faf9-4a18-99ad-5d36d1371713 - - - - -] [f6f92ad8-7a93-4a70-aab3-6720a5eb20d] AMQP server on test-controller-1.internalapi.localdomain:5672 is unreachable: [Errno -2] No address found. Trying again in 1 seconds. Client port: None gaierror: [Errno -2] No address found

The hostname was test-controller-0.localdomain and the entry in
/etc/hosts was the following:
172.17.1.18 TEST-controller-0.internalapi.localdomain TEST-controller-0.internalapi

Let's lowercase all entries in any case.

Reported-By: Marian Krcmari <mkrcmari@redhat.com>

subject: Allow read-only Commands to bypass txns in execute()
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-04-23 14:55:17.000000000', 'files': ['ovsdbapp/schema/ovn_northbound/commands.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ovsdbapp/commit/385663fd92a5abcc1836d40b62095c1b5d884fea', 'message': "Allow read-only Commands to bypass txns in execute()

This patch continues https://review.opendev.org/#/c/633070/.

Since the ovs_idl backend maintains an in-memory copy of the DB,
read-only commands can be executed w/o creating a transaction.
Since it is possible for a function that calls execute() to be
automatically nested into an existing transaction, execute()
wasn't able to access the result since it only happens once the
parent transaction completed. Handling these read-only commands
w/o creating a transaction allows the results to be read and
avoids wasting resources by creating needless transactions.

ReadOnlyCommands can still be used in with transaction(): blocks
with no changes.

Change-Id: Ic3f7cd5733b7a28acc74345e7faa182ebd3a69b0
Closes-Bug: #1873305
"}]
commit_message:
Allow read-only Commands to bypass txns in execute()

This patch continues https://review.opendev.org/#/c/633070/.

Since the ovs_idl backend maintains an in-memory copy of the DB,
read-only commands can be executed w/o creating a transaction.
Since it is possible for a function that calls execute() to be
automatically nested into an existing transaction, execute()
wasn't able to access the result since it only happens once the
parent transaction completed. Handling these read-only commands
w/o creating a transaction allows the results to be read and
avoids wasting resources by creating needless transactions.

ReadOnlyCommands can still be used in with transaction(): blocks
with no changes.

Change-Id: Ic3f7cd5733b7a28acc74345e7faa182ebd3a69b0
Closes-Bug: #1873305
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ovsdbapp refs/changes/45/722345/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Update container certificate

Due to the bind-mounting of the actual PEM file rather than the directory
we cannot simply copy the new file to the location on the host, we need to
copy the updated PEM into the container.  This patch also removes outdated
and no longer working container detection code that was preventing any of
the tasks from ever running.

RHBZ: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1765839

Change-Id: Ie275001aabe16241d2036d39fce294f86f88e7c8
Closes-Bug: 1875746

commit_message:
Fix configure-vm.py and xml file for centos8

Fixing configure-vm script and vm.xml with this patch because for
latest OS like centos8 - older python version and older qemu machine
type is causing issue.

* For configure-vm.py - Replacing python with python3 in environment
path as python3 is the default in many latest OS.

* For vm.xml - Replacing Machine type from pc-1.0 to pc.
- pc-1.0 is old and unsupported machine type for Centos8
- Moving machine type from pc-1.0 to pc will help as pc have alias to
supported qemu machine type

Related-Bug: #1875681
Change-Id: Icd7e98ceb8859f730a32981a150f2730bde9836b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/71/724071/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
[NetApp] Fix share shrink error status

This patch fixes the error raised by NetApp driver when the user try
to shrink a share to a size smaller than the current used space. Now
the driver raises "shrinking_possible_data_loss" instead of
"shrinking_error".

Change-Id: I01a549a0e299ae0d0d9b603a9d0797f16f4b68b3
Closes-Bug: #1858328
(cherry picked from commit c169902d41ef2b70ce1c1181408bc0916a7ea319)
(cherry picked from commit 97a913209825f975ccfc2d76c91f4215d02622ad)
(cherry picked from commit d7853ae6ed258077eab90fb29055a055e085a5fd)

commit_message:
[NetApp] Fix share replica failing for 'transfer in progress' error

This patch fix an issue in NetApp driver share replica periodic
check that erroneuouly set a share replica to error after receiving
a 'Another transfer is in progress' error. The driver now skips the
resync operation for all expected transfer in progress relationship
status.

Closes-Bug: #1848889
Change-Id: If82aaa184db84660389f82654279f3c5b238fd51
(cherry picked from commit 572be43bb03a67376b52a11c70e587eb160b68a3)
(cherry picked from commit cc2dea14a514ad1a7025d904074307817c60e3ce)
(cherry picked from commit 48f3e09d12f38084a16309360fd2fbdddd441c4f)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/47/724347/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- fixes: - | Fixed an issue in NetApp driver share replica periodic check that erroneously set a replica state to 'error'. In this routine, a SnapMirror resync operation was being triggered while the replica data transfering is still in progress, receiving an error from the storage side. The driver now skips resync operation for all in progress SnapMirror relationship status.

commit_message:
WIP Keep hash of config of previous run around

This is useful in deployment_tasks to detect if the config has changed
compared to the previous run and it avoids having to look for that
info in podman inspect.

Change-Id: Ie16f42138d039e43df517467532aaa58f0b5f1db
Related-Bug: #1863442

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ie13f0c75090d707a60d9b886d436bbbcd07066a5

subject: Bump default tox env from py37 to py38
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-04-24 15:33:30.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-glanceclient/commit/490f808c4f47bc41e5ef81af91dd0448e1312d52', 'message': 'Bump default tox env from py37 to py38

Python 3.8 is now our highest level supported python runtime.
This updates the default tox target environments to swap out
py37 for py38 to make sure local development testing is
covering this version.

This does not impact zuul jobs in any way, nor prevent local
tests against py37. It just changes the default if none is
explicitly provided.

commit_message:
Bump default tox env from py37 to py38

Python 3.8 is now our highest level supported python runtime.
This updates the default tox target environments to swap out
py37 for py38 to make sure local development testing is
covering this version.

This does not impact zuul jobs in any way, nor prevent local
tests against py37. It just changes the default if none is
explicitly provided.

Change-Id: Id27c5ad8a9d4a00f37d4a3ff7f8a71780df50fb0
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-glanceclient refs/changes/76/722876/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Pin sh library used for molecule tests

This pin works for python2 and python3 environments
and resolves:

https://github.com/ansible-community/molecule/issues/2676

We unfortunately have molecule pinned, so we won't
inherit any fixes (including this one) from newer
releases.

Change-Id: I0548b0a20abbc8a0c0ac3c7d88c93c0180a87a77

Add a method to prevent an ip being set on an interface

This can be used to set the MTU on interfaces that make up
a bond.

commit_message:
compute: Add stable device rescue tests with BFV instances

This change introduces tests for stable device rescue with boot from
volume instances using blank, image and snapshot based volumes.

Change-Id: Ic5e38c6da710e1e5fb40b186d8da537eef48b1a5

commit_message:
Adapt to Octavia Certificate Configuration Guide.

This patch updates the octavia controller deployment to use the
latest octavia certificate configuration guide [1]. The dual CA changes
were introduced in Train.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/octavia/latest/admin/guides/certificates.html

Change-Id: If89ec0d631568db70690f1a69d00115c59abe678
Closes-Bug: #1862133
(cherry picked from commit e84c968ed21764fd8859d369c2aa50bd10ef0937)

subject: Lowercase ironic driver hash ring and ignore case in cache
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-04-24 22:51:22.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/ironic/driver.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/ironic/test_driver.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/019e3da75bc6fb171b32a012ce339075fe690ca7', 'message': "Lowercase ironic driver hash ring and ignore case in cache

Recently we had a customer case where attempts to add new ironic nodes
to an existing undercloud resulted in half of the nodes failing to be
detected and added to nova. Ironic API returned all of the newly added
nodes when called by the driver, but half of the nodes were not
returned to the compute manager by the driver.

There was only one nova-compute service managing all of the ironic
nodes of the all-in-one typical undercloud deployment.

After days of investigation and examination of a database dump from the
customer, we noticed that at some point the customer had changed the
hostname of the machine from something containing uppercase letters to
the same name but all lowercase. The nova-compute service record had
the mixed case name and the CONF.host (socket.gethostname()) had the
lowercase name.

The hash ring logic adds all of the nova-compute service hostnames plus
CONF.host to hash ring, then the ironic driver reports only the nodes
it owns by retrieving a service hostname from the ring based on a hash
of each ironic node UUID.

Because of the machine hostname change, the hash ring contained, for
example: {'MachineHostName', 'machinehostname'} when it should have
contained only one hostname. And because the hash ring contained two
hostnames, the driver was able to retrieve only half of the nodes as
nodes that it owned. So half of the new nodes were excluded and not
added as new compute nodes.

This adds lowercasing of hosts that are added to the hash ring and
ignores case when comparing the CONF.host to the hash ring members
to avoid unnecessary pain and confusion for users that make hostname
changes that are otherwise functionally harmless.

This also adds logging of the set of hash ring members at level DEBUG
to help enable easier debugging of hash ring related situations.

Closes-Bug: #1866380

 Conflicts:
	nova/virt/ironic/driver.py

NOTE(melwitt): Conflict is because change
I1b184ff37948dc403fe38874613cd4d870c644fd is not in Rocky.

Change-Id: I617fd59de327de05a198f12b75a381f21945afb0
(cherry picked from commit 7145100ee4e732caa532d614e2149ef2a545287a)
(cherry picked from commit 588b0484bf6f5fe41514f1428aeaf5613635e35a)
(cherry picked from commit 8f8667a8dd0e453eaef8f75a3fff25db62d4cc17)
"}]
commit_message:
Lowercase ironic driver hash ring and ignore case in cache

Recently we had a customer case where attempts to add new ironic nodes
to an existing undercloud resulted in half of the nodes failing to be
detected and added to nova. Ironic API returned all of the newly added
nodes when called by the driver, but half of the nodes were not
returned to the compute manager by the driver.

There was only one nova-compute service managing all of the ironic
nodes of the all-in-one typical undercloud deployment.

After days of investigation and examination of a database dump from the
customer, we noticed that at some point the customer had changed the
hostname of the machine from something containing uppercase letters to
the same name but all lowercase. The nova-compute service record had
the mixed case name and the CONF.host (socket.gethostname()) had the
lowercase name.

The hash ring logic adds all of the nova-compute service hostnames plus
CONF.host to hash ring, then the ironic driver reports only the nodes
it owns by retrieving a service hostname from the ring based on a hash
of each ironic node UUID.

Because of the machine hostname change, the hash ring contained, for
example: {'MachineHostName', 'machinehostname'} when it should have
contained only one hostname. And because the hash ring contained two
hostnames, the driver was able to retrieve only half of the nodes as
nodes that it owned. So half of the new nodes were excluded and not
added as new compute nodes.

This adds lowercasing of hosts that are added to the hash ring and
ignores case when comparing the CONF.host to the hash ring members
to avoid unnecessary pain and confusion for users that make hostname
changes that are otherwise functionally harmless.

This also adds logging of the set of hash ring members at level DEBUG
to help enable easier debugging of hash ring related situations.

Closes-Bug: #1866380

 Conflicts:
	nova/virt/ironic/driver.py

NOTE(melwitt): Conflict is because change
I1b184ff37948dc403fe38874613cd4d870c644fd is not in Rocky.

Change-Id: I617fd59de327de05a198f12b75a381f21945afb0
(cherry picked from commit 7145100ee4e732caa532d614e2149ef2a545287a)
(cherry picked from commit 588b0484bf6f5fe41514f1428aeaf5613635e35a)

commit_message:
[WIP] Use latest python construct library

Python construct library version 2.10 removed Embedded and
EmbeddedSwitch [0], we should adapt our code to be able to
migrate to a more recent version.

[0] https://construct.readthedocs.io/en/latest/transition210.html

commit_message:
Use unittest.mock instead of third party mock

horizon recently switched from the third-party mock to unittest.mock.
This breaks heat-dashboard unit tests somehow.
We no longer support py27 and we can use the standard library
unittest.mock module. Rather than investigating the cause of
the failure, it would be nice to switch to unittest.mock.

horizon dependency is updated to 18.3.1 as unittest.mock is used
since 18.3.0 and 18.3.0 has an issue that it always requires pytest.
lower-constraints is updated to match horizon requirements.

hacking local-check-factory is disabled temporarily due to
the incompatibility with hacking 2.0 or later.
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/715690/ will recover it.

Change-Id: I517d6d7d36410c64bf48ad958b3e2115725a6491
(cherry picked from commit bd68639408372c938766bc53c6cc305b8a9743ce)

commit_message:
Parametrize patch strip option in workarounds.

Right now, all the workarounds are patched using the strip option
--p set to 1. That works in most of the cases, but for some directories
/projects it's needed to pass a different strip value (tripleo-ansible)
causing all workarounds to not been applied.

This patch adds a new workarounds option patch_strip which accepts an
integer and will set the -p option at the time of applying the workaround.
If the option is not passed, the default value will be 1.

Change-Id: I0cb5d26838cf38bb04e22cfa3a06e06177eebd55

commit_message:
[Community goal] Update contributor documentation

As the Ussuri goal we have an OpenStack project wide contributing
documentation template [1]. os-vif use its own bug or feature
tracking LP and core team is also not exactly same as nova so adding
its own contributor guide with keeping common links from nova
with os-vif specific information.

Also the top level CONTRIBUTING.rst template has been changed in the
cookiecutter repo[2]. So this patch updates the CONTRIBUTING.rst according
to the new template.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/cookiecutter/src/branch/master/%7b%7bcookiecutter.repo_name%7d%7d/$
[2] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/696001

Change-Id: I6017fdbb403d4cd90f4c3c2bd4a197dfbb67f6ec
Story: #2007236
Task: #38541

commit_message:
Add support for encrypting Horizon and Placement API

This patch introduces an optional backend encryption for Horizon and
Placement services. When used in conjunction with enabling TLS for
service API endpoints, network communcation will be encrypted end to
end, from client through HAProxy to the Horizon and Placement services.

Change-Id: I9cb274141c95aea20e733baa623da071b30acf2d
Partially-Implements: blueprint add-ssl-internal-network

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I3456e8fd7e3a24d4dd60454f11c934232fe399cf

commit_message:
FFWD automation for HA and composable environments

We need to run in quite tedious order to upgrade properly
the Pacemaker managed roles. First we split the environment
into Pacemaker enabled, Non-Pacemaker Non-Compute and Compute
groups of roles:

Pacemaker: ['Controller','Database','Messaging']
Non-Pacemaker&Non-Compute: ['Ceph','Networking','Objectstorage']
Compute: ['Compute','OSDCompute']

For Pacemaker we have to upgrade one of each roles in the Pacemaker
group together - controller-0,database-0,messaging-0 to ensure that
upgrade will work. We can run system upgrade in parallel on them
too.

The tricky part with Pacemaker is that than we need to run upgrade
on the one node of each role in the Pacemaker group but also on all
previous Pacemaker nodes to ensure we don't create several separated
clusters.

For the rest it's simply faster to run for each role in the group.

Change-Id: I65b3f3f45f975be90438b3cdc3c8e24cd290d0a8

commit_message:
Simplify ffwd2 CIP stein parameters.

Currently, the ContainerImagePrepare parameters required for FFWD2
to work are harcoded in the defaults/main.yaml. However, the
namespace_stein variable, should point at the same value the namespace
variable points. This patch simplifies a little the logic, adds a new
fact full_namespace that stores the content of the namespace field from
the containers-prepare-parameters.yaml file and assigns the namespace_stein
key to it.

Change-Id: I07967e0590aee9c86a6427469914f65fbdb3929d

commit_message:
Build enablerepo options automatically for leapp when not subsribed.

A new option added into leapp lets us configure a set of repositories to run
leapp with. This new option is compatible with rhos-release, removing the need
for an special leapp actor.
This patch checks the rhos-release repos configured locally in the Undercloud
and builds a --enablerepo string with all the repos obtained. This string is
then passed at the time of running leapp, if the machine isn't using a
subscription.

This patch also cleans up some unnecessary code to handle differente leapp
versions, as our CI now works with latest leapp version. As well as some
unsupported Leapp environment variables [0].

[0]-https://github.com/oamg/leapp/blob/69f3f8c21dae5fbe270701e5728b8e2512faddb6/docs/source/el7toel8/envars.md

Change-Id: Ife2734547c4c981dece0c0f9b436eb10e99dd1b1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-upgrade refs/changes/67/721567/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Update master for stable/ussuri

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/ussuri.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/ussuri.

Change-Id: Ie52668228b9f16f62b2e4fa37558c78da47b6629
Sem-Ver: feature

favor of using the openstack-lower-constraints-jobs template.

commit_message:
Clean up zuul jobs

Individual jobs that are included in a job template were individually
defined in each queue to pull in the nova repo, but this is not needed
for running unit tests.

This removes the individual jobs so only the template defined ones are
run. It also gets rid of the openstack-tox-lower-constraints job in
favor of using the openstack-lower-constraints-jobs template.

Change-Id: Iee4ce1612d2a38585b7c5db8db71b1619216a1fa
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Update master for stable/ussuri

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/ussuri.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/ussuri.

Change-Id: Ifa67860398e382ed6349eb932f27280973c8fc42
Sem-Ver: feature

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I80d575844076899a7f2bd5e3cc4df67d70287915
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tempest refs/changes/41/724041/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

added_lines: # # Copyright (C) 2018 Red Hat, Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. # require 'spec_helper' describe 'tripleo::profile::base::neutron::wrappers::haproxy' do let :title do 'haproxy_wrapper' end shared_examples_for 'tripleo::profile::base::neutron::wrappers::haproxy' do context 'creates wrapper file for docker' do let(:params) { { :haproxy_process_wrapper => '/usr/local/bin/haproxy', :haproxy_image => 'a_registry/some_container_name:some_tag', :bind_socket => 'unix:///run/another/docker.sock', :container_cli => 'docker', :debug => true, } } it 'should generate a wrapper file' do is_expected.to contain_file('/usr/local/bin/haproxy').with( :mode => '0755' ) is_expected.to contain_file('/usr/local/bin/haproxy').with_content( /a_registry.some_container_name.some_tag/ ) is_expected.to contain_file('/usr/local/bin/haproxy').with_content( /^NAME=neutron-haproxy-/ ) is_expected.to contain_file('/usr/local/bin/haproxy').with_content( /export DOCKER_HOST="unix:...run.another.docker.sock/ ) is_expected.to contain_file('/usr/local/bin/haproxy').with_content( /set -x/ ) is_expected.to contain_file('/usr/local/bin/haproxy').with_content( /.*haproxy -Ds.*haproxy -Ws.*/ ) end end context 'creates wrapper file for podman' do let(:params) { { :haproxy_process_wrapper => '/usr/local/bin/haproxy', :haproxy_image => 'a_registry/some_container_name:some_tag', :container_cli => 'podman', :debug => false, } } it 'should generate a wrapper file' do is_expected.to contain_file('/usr/local/bin/haproxy').with( :mode => '0755' ) is_expected.to contain_file('/usr/local/bin/haproxy').with_content( /a_registry.some_container_name.some_tag/ ) is_expected.to contain_file('/usr/local/bin/haproxy').with_content( /^NAME=neutron-haproxy-/ ) is_expected.to contain_file('/usr/local/bin/haproxy').with_content( /.*haproxy -Ds.*haproxy -Ws.*/ ) end end end on_supported_os.each do |os, facts| context "on #{os}" do let(:facts) do facts.merge({ :hostname => 'node.example.com' }) end it_behaves_like 'tripleo::profile::base::neutron::wrappers::haproxy' end end end

commit_message:
Allow artcl to be run by Zuul

- Avoid implicit use of lookup env which breaks under Zuul CI
- Add Zuul job that tests direct role usage and avoids regression.
  Follows layout used by zuul-jobs repository.

Change-Id: I1cdd31bfc28131a77a1596b87d081957c9089550
Story: https://tree.taiga.io/project/tripleo-ci-board/us/1458

commit_message:
CI: migrate UEFI jobs to Cirros 0.5.1

It's supposed to include the patch we need, and using the final
release allows us to benefit from caching of images by the infra.

Change-Id: Iabef3fa7e3af7fb6fd19973d6a44908d5a3ce93b
(cherry picked from commit 0e401f3afee590d0b4e8b81289753d2b4c012612)

Download both disk and uec images. # NOTE (vdrok): Here the images are actually pre-cached by devstack, in # the files folder, so they won't be downloaded again. add_image_link http://download.cirros-cloud.net/${CIRROS_VERSION}/cirros-${CIRROS_VERSION}-x86_64-uec.tar.gz add_image_link http://download.cirros-cloud.net/${CIRROS_VERSION}/cirros-${CIRROS_VERSION}-x86_64-disk.img

Download both disk and uec images. # NOTE (vdrok): Here the images are actually pre-cached by devstack, in # the files folder, so they won't be downloaded again. add_image_link http://download.cirros-cloud.net/${CIRROS_VERSION}/cirros-${CIRROS_VERSION}-x86_64-uec.tar.gz add_image_link http://download.cirros-cloud.net/${CIRROS_VERSION}/cirros-${CIRROS_VERSION}-x86_64-disk.img fi
